quote: Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.
Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.
A politician divides mankind into two classes; tools and enemies.
Am I not destroying my enemies when I make friends of them?
No accurate thinker will judge another person by that which the other person's enemies say about him.
Observe your enemies, for they first find out your faults.
A friend is one who has the same enemies as you have.
A lawyer is a gentlemen that rescues your estate from your enemies and then keeps it to himself.
A man can't be too careful in the choice of his enemies.
A man cannot be too careful in the choice of his enemies.
Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.
Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.
A politician divides mankind into two classes; tools and enemies.
Am I not destroying my enemies when I make friends of them?
No accurate thinker will judge another person by that which the other person's enemies say about him.
Observe your enemies, for they first find out your faults.
A friend is one who has the same enemies as you have.
A lawyer is a gentlemen that rescues your estate from your enemies and then keeps it to himself.
A man can't be too careful in the choice of his enemies.
A man cannot be too careful in the choice of his enemies.
A man's doubts and fears are his worst enemies.
A President is best judged by the enemies he makes when he has really hit his stride.
A wise man learns more from his enemies than a fool from his friends.
Ambition. An overmastering desire to be vilified by enemies while living and made ridiculous by friends when dead.
Anger and intolerance are the enemies of correct understanding.
Anger and intolerance are the twin enemies of correct understanding.
Beware of no man more than of yourself; we carry our worst enemies within us.
Bored with your present enemies? Make new ones! Tell two of your women friends that they look alike.
Comforts and syphilis are the greatest enemies of mankind.
Convictions are more dangerous enemies of truth than lies.
Do good to your friends to keep them, to your enemies to win them.
Enemies are so stimulating.
Enemies are so stimulating.
Enemies promises were made to be broken.
Even a paranoid can have enemies.
Father and son are natural enemies and each is happier and more secure in keeping it that way.
For every ten jokes you acquire a hundred enemies.
Forgive your enemies, but never forget their names.
Friends come and go but enemies accumulate.
Friends may come and go, but enemies accumulate.
He has no enemies, but is intensely disliked by his friends.
I can be on guard against my enemies, but God deliver me from my friends!
I don't feel I have to wipe everybody out, Tom. Just my enemies.
I have had a lot of adversaries in my political life, but no enemies that I can remember.
I no doubt deserved my enemies, but I don't believe I deserved my friends.
If you have no enemies you are apt to be in the same predicament in regard to friends.
If you want to make enemies, try to change something.
In my life, I have prayed but one prayer: oh Lord, make my enemies ridiculous. And God granted it.
In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends
In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
Instead of loving your enemies - treat your friends a little better.
It is a pitiful fortune that is not without enemies.
It is always safe to learn, even from our enemies; seldom safe to venture to instruct, even our friends.
It is difficult to say who do you the most harm: enemies with the worst intentions or friends with the best.
It is not necessary to have enemies if you go out of your way to make friends hate you.
Learning carries within itself certain dangers because out of necessity one has to learn from one's enemies.
Lord, protect me from my friends; I can take care of my enemies.
Love your enemies just in case your friends turn out to be a bunch of bastards.
Love your enemies, for they tell you your faults.
Many have had their greatness made for them by their enemies.
May God defend me from my friends; I can defend myself from my enemies.
May God have mercy uppon my enemies, because i won't.
Money can't buy you friends; but you do get a better class of enemies.
My prayer to God is a very short one: ''O Lord, make my enemies look ridiculous!'' God has granted it.
Never explain - your friends do not need it, and your enemies will not believe you anyway.
Never explain - your friends don't need it and your enemies won't believe you anyway.
Never hate your enemies. It affects your judgment.
No accurate thinker will judge another person by that which the other person's enemies say about him.
One should not lift the rod against our enemies upon the private information of another.
Only enemies speak the truth. Friends and lovers lie endlessly, caught in the web of duty.
Pay attention to your enemies for they are the first to discover your mistakes.
Progress is a nice word, but change is its motivator and change has enemies.
Progress is a nice word. But change is its motivator. And change has its enemies.
Promises may fit the friends, but non-performance will turn them into enemies.
The enemies of the future are always the very nicest people.
The first glass is for myself, the second for my friends, the third for good humor, and the forth for my enemies.
The ideal, without doubt, varies, but its enemies, alas, are always the same.
The Irish do not want anyone to wish them well; they want everyone to wish their enemies ill.
The person who has no enemies has no followers.
The sufferings that fate inflicts on us should be borne with patience, what enemies inflict with manly courage.
The two enemies of human happiness are pain and boredom.
There can be no true friends without true enemies. Unless we hate what we are not, we cannot love what we are.
Treachery and violence are spears pointed at both ends; they wound those who resort to them worse than their enemies.
Victimizers of children are the enemies of any so-called society.
We do not merely destroy our enemies; we change them.
We make our friends; we make our enemies; but God makes our next door neighbor.
We often give our enemies the means for our own destruction.
When a virtuous man is raised, it brings gladness to his friends, grief to his enemies, and glory to his posterity.
When we turn to one another for counsel we reduce the number of our enemies.
Who are enemies? Those who oppose each others will.
Wise men learn many things from their enemies.
You have enemies? Good. That means you've stood up for something, sometime in your life.
You may depend upon it that he is a good man whose intimate friends are all good, and whose enemies are decidedly bad.
Our enemies approach nearer to truth in their judgments of us than we do ourselves.
Our enemies come nearer the truth in the opinions they form of us than we do in our opinion of ourselves.
